alert.note: Alert for West Elk and Sawatch Mountains (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Avalanche Warning issued January 11 at 10:11AM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: THE FOLLOWING MESSAGE IS TRANSMITTED AT THE REQUEST OF THE COLORADO AVALANCHE INFORMATION CENTER. ...AVALANCHE WARNING IN EFFECT 7 AM THURSDAY UNTIL 5 AM MONDAY... *WHAT...Heavy snow and strong winds are resulting in very dangerous avalanche conditions and a HIGH (Level 4 of 5) avalanche danger *WHERE...Ruby Range and Ragged Mountains, west of Crested Butte and south of Marble *WHEN...Very dangerous avalanche conditions developed overnight on Wednesday. Large natural avalanches are running. *IMPACTS...Large and dangerous avalanches will be very easy to trigger in many places. Avalanches will run naturally. *PRECAUTION/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Travel in backcountry avalanche terrain is not recommended. Avoid travel on and under slopes steeper than about 30 degrees. You can find more detailed information at colorado.gov/avalanche
